definition: to hand over/to pass on sth/to gradually increase or decrease/progressively

sentences.english: The dog has nipped the postmen on the leg.
sentences.chinese: 這條狗咬了郵遞員的腿。

sentences.english: That postman is in charge of this route.
sentences.chinese: 那個郵遞員負責這條投遞線路。

sentences.english: The postman comes at 6.30 in the morning, at which time I am usually fast asleep.
sentences.chinese: 郵遞員早晨六點半就到，而這時我通常還熟睡着呢。

sentences.english: The mailman hasn't been round yet.
I was very excited when I accepted the admission notice from the postman.
sentences.chinese: 我從郵遞員手中接過錄取通知書，心情非常激動。

sentences.english: Mailmen sort the mails at the post offices before distribution.
sentences.chinese: 郵件在寄走前由郵遞員在郵局分發。

sentences.english: Then the letter can bee - mailed to remote, high- altitude post - offices in this Himalayan region.
sentences.chinese: 郵遞員是這些偏僻地區和外界聯繫的唯一方式。

sentences.english: The mailman collects the letters away every morning.
sentences.chinese: 郵遞員每天早上來收信。

sentences.english: Post man impressed his seal on the envelope.
sentences.chinese: 郵遞員在信封上印上他的私章。

sentences.english: As soon as the postman passed her the letter, Mary tore yt open.
sentences.chinese: 馬莉從郵遞員手中一接過信，就把它撕開了。

sentences.english: Third, the postage was high at that time.
sentences.chinese: 第三，那時候郵費很高，郵遞員要收郵資很困難。

sentences.english: The mail runner is the only means of communication in some remote areas.
sentences.chinese: 郵遞員是這些偏僻地區和外界聯繫的唯一方式。

sentences.english: When you have a post-office box , postman will not bring letters to you .
sentences.chinese: 當你有了一個郵箱時，郵遞員就不會再給你送信來了。

sentences.english: The mailman always comes at 2 o'clock.
Every day, mailmen deliver letters and parcels to homes.
sentences.chinese: 郵遞員每天將信和包裹投到家裏。

sentences.english: As we were having breakfast, a postman called.
sentences.chinese: 我們正在喫早飯時，郵遞員叫門了。

definition: Yingshan County in Fuyang 阜陽|阜阳[Fu4 yang2], Anhui
public security authorities, acronym from 公安局[gong1 an1 ju2], 檢察院|检察院[jian3 cha2 yuan4] and 法院[fa3 yuan4]
abbr. for 國家安全局|国家安全局[Guo2 jia1 An1 quan2 ju2]
to eliminate/to sack/to remove from office
variant of 誣衊|诬蔑[wu1 mie4]
to use violence (against sb)/to strong-arm sb/to manhandle
(coll.) to tamper with/to mess around with
to relieve sb of his post/to sack/to demote/dismissal/sacking
